speaker: SCULLY
line: From Space, it seems an abstraction-- a magician's trick on a darkened stage. And from this distance one might never imagine that it is alive. It first appeared in the sea almost four billion years ago in the form of single-celled life. In an explosion of life spanning millions of years, nature's first multicellular organisms began to multiply... and then it stopped. 440 million years ago, a great mass extinction would kill off nearly every species on the planet leaving the vast oceans decimated and empty. Slowly, plants began to evolve, then insects, only to be wiped out in the second great mass extinction upon the Earth. The cycle repeated again and again. Reptiles emerging, independent of the sea only to be killed off. Then dinosaurs, struggling to life along with the first birds, fish, and flowering plants - their decimations Earth's fourth and fifth great extinctions. Only 100,000 years ago, Homo Sapiens appear-- man. From cave paintings to the bible to Columbus and Apollo 11, we have been a tireless force upon the earth and off cataloguing the natural world as it unfolds to us. Rising to a world population of over five billion people all descended from that original single cell, that first spark of life. But for all our knowledge, what no one can say for certain, is what or who ignited that original spark. Is there a plan, a purpose or a reason to our existence? Will we pass, as those before us, into oblivion, into the sixth extinction that scientists warn is already in progress?

speaker: (FADE TO
line: African coast. Men are shouting excitedly in Swahili. They kneel down at the water's edge and look at a broken metal fragment that is sticking up out of the sand. It has strange writing on it. Close up on fragment as the water washes over it.)

speaker: SCULLY
line: Or will the mystery be revealed through a sign, a symbol, a revelation?

speaker: DR. MERKMALLEN
line: Yes, get me the international operator, please. I need to place a call to the United States.

speaker: DR. MERKMALLEN
line: Excuse me, I'm looking for the Biology Department for a Professor Sandoz.

speaker: DR. MERKMALLEN
line: Dr. Sandoz? Professor Sandoz, I'm Solomon Merkmallen.

speaker: MAN
line: Dr. Merkmallen. My God, I thought something had happened to you.

speaker: DR. MERKMALLEN
line: Oh. Did you not get my message? We were delayed in Frankfurt.

speaker: MAN
line: Look, the important thing is you're here now, and you're safe.

speaker: DR. MERKMALLEN
line: Yes.

speaker: MAN
line: Uh... you brought me something-- this, uh... this discovery of yours.

speaker: DR. MERKMALLEN
line: Yes.

speaker: MAN
line: I'm quite anxious to see it.

speaker: DR. MERKMALLEN
line: I-I was concerned I might be relieved of it in customs. There was some trouble with the X-ray machine in Germany.

speaker: MAN
line: What kind of trouble did you have?

speaker: DR. MERKMALLEN
line: I told you of its power.

speaker: MAN
line: Yes, of course.

speaker: DR. MERKMALLEN
line: My credentials were the only thing that prevented me from being further detained.

speaker: DR. MERKMALLEN
line: I can't explain how it is... but the two pieces have become one. I was hoping they'd match the piece that you've found so that you might see for yourself its magic.

speaker: MAN
line: Have you had any luck reading it?

speaker: DR. MERKMALLEN
line: You're not Dr. Sandoz, are you?

speaker: SKINNER
line: A case like this I, of course, thought of your obvious interest-- Dr. Merkmallen's views and theories being what they were. I believe Agent Mulder is familiar with his work.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dr. Solomon Merkmallen, Professor of Biology, University of Ivory Coast.

speaker: SKINNER
line: He flew in yesterday from Africa. Two hours later, he was apparently murdered at American University. His body is missing but there was enough blood found on the floor to make a fair assumption. A couple of students also confirmed that they spoke to him when he asked them for directions to find a Dr. Steven Sandoz, also a Professor of Biology.

speaker: MULDER
line: Both men espouse a fringe theory called "Panspermia." It's the belief that life originated...

speaker: SCULLY
line: … elsewhere... in this universe.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You've heard of this?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. It's the idea that Mars or other planets were habitable long before Earth and that, uh, cosmic collisions on these planets blasted microbes into our solar system - some of which landed and flourished here.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You'd accept that as plausible?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, almost any scientist would... theoretically. I mean, it's just a theory. That's about it, though. You don't think this has anything to do with his death, do you?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Dr. Merkmallen found an artifact in his country. This is a rubbing of that artifact. He claimed it contained a message- not only of his Mars theories but the very meaning of human existence.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Much less plausible.

speaker: MULDER
line: Dr. Sandoz, the man he'd come to meet made a similar claim in a … … "science"... journal. He said he'd found an artifact that was almost identical to that with similar writings on it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And what was it supposed to say?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, we'd have to ask Dr. Sandoz that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, why don't we?

speaker: MULDER
line: We can't. He's missing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are we doing, Mulder? This is a police matter at best.

speaker: MULDER
line: Skinner wants us on the case.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you going to try and convince me that you have no personal interest in this case?

speaker: MULDER
line: I am just a hired gun for the FBI.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, come on.

speaker: MULDER
line: What if there's something to this?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Two men suggesting that we're all Martians. Now why would they possibly come into foul play?

speaker: MULDER
line: That's what we're being asked to figure out.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't understand you, Mulder. You're willing to pursue any case involving aliens no matter how tenuous the connection. There has to be some limit to your interest... I mean, this endless pursuit of the truth, Mulder it just... it doesn't make any sense to me now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder? Did you hear a word of what I just said?

speaker: MULDER
line: No.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No? Well, maybe you didn't want to hear it.

speaker: MULDER
line: No... I couldn't hear it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder... look, after all you've done, after all you've uncovered-- a conspiracy of men doing human experiments, men who are all now dead-- you exposed their secrets. I mean, you've won. What more could you possibly hope to do or to find?

speaker: MULDER
line: My sister.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Guess I was right about this being a police matter. Detective?

speaker: DETECTIVE
line: Can I help you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agents Mulder and Scully with the FBI. What do you have here?

speaker: DETECTIVE
line: Probable weapon-- blood and hair on it. Looks like prints, too..

speaker: SCULLY
line: Any word on this Dr. Sandoz?

speaker: DETECTIVE
line: No, but we're being told the prints are very likely his.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Told by whom?

speaker: DETECTIVE
line: The man your partner's speaking with.

speaker: MULDER
line: Fox Mulder with the FBI.

speaker: DR. BARNES
line: I'm Dr. Barnes, head of the department. They've asked me to suspend classes and organize interviews with the faculty.

speaker: MULDER
line: Any ideas yourself about what happened here?

speaker: DR. BARNES
line: There's plenty of speculation.

speaker: MULDER
line: About the missing Dr. Sandoz?

speaker: DR. BARNES
line: Apart from his laughable ideas my colleague was capable of almost anything to advance his rather questionable reputation.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Capable of murder?

speaker: DR. BARNES
line: Dr. Sandoz's notes are full of talk about an artifact coming over from West Africa but like the man who was bringing it that artifact has yet to be located.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you, uh, speaking of this?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

speaker: DR. BARNES
line: Do you know Dr. Sandoz believes this writing was from aliens? These are trivial men. They have no patience for the scientific process. They're happy to read their names in the tabloids. Pseudo scientists. Beyond embarrassment.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What is it, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know. It's, uh... a hollow noise. The same thing that happened to me at work in the elevator this morning.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you have a fever?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. This is going to sound weird but I think it's that thing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're not kidding. It's just a piece of paper.

speaker: CHUCK BURKS
line: I recognize the ideography.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're late.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm sorry. I thought this was my office.

speaker: CHUCK BURKS
line: Fox.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I called Chuck as I knew you would for authentication, and to get his professional opinion on how you say it's affecting you.

speaker: CHUCK BURKS
line: Fascinating, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: You don't believe it, Chuck?

speaker: CHUCK BURKS
line: No, no. You know me. This is right up my twisted little alley. So, uh... what exactly are you experiencing?

speaker: MULDER
line: Noise. Aural dissonance. It comes and it goes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is it happening right now?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, but it was a few minutes ago.

speaker: CHUCK BURKS
line: And it's only affecting you, triggered by the rubbing. Wow. That blows me away.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Because the rubbing is a fake and I'm not the first one to say so..

speaker: CHUCK BURKS
line: The writing is Cree-- phonetic Navaho-- but no literal interpretation makes any sense.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And the fact that it was found in Africa makes it all the mores suspicious as a fabrication.

speaker: MULDER
line: Suspicious of what?

speaker: CHUCK BURKS
line: Do you know what a Magic Square is?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. It has to do with the occult.

speaker: CHUCK BURKS
line: Right. Very cool. They first appear in the ninth century in history but, uh... … as the story goes God himself instructed Adam in their use and then handed down the secret to all his saints and prophets and wise men as a way of trapping and storing potential power to the person whose name or numerical correlative exercises that power.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's what this thing is?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, that's what someone would have you believe this is.

speaker: MULDER
line: How do you know that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: As it turns out neither of us had to go very far to find out.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Barnes documented Sandoz's fakery once before. If he was blunt about his colleague when we met him, in here, he is downright brutal.

speaker: MULDER
line: Does he back any of that up?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, it's quite scholarly, actually.

speaker: CHUCK BURKS
line: Barnes has made something of a career exposing science and religious fraud. Name your wonder of the world-- he's been there, debunked that.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, but wouldn't it be in his great interest to hide something that he couldn't disprove with his scholarship?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, if it were real then why would an American Indian artifact be fused in rock on the west coast of the African continent?

speaker: MULDER
line: In 1996, a rock from Mars was found in Antarctica. How did it get there?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It was from outer space.

speaker: CHUCK BURKS
line: Begs the question, doesn't it? Why produce a fraud with Navaho writing... in Africa?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder? Hey.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hmm.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Let's step outside. Step outside.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're in pain.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, no, it's going away.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, whatever is causing this I think it needs immediate attention. I'm going to schedule you an imagining scan.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I'm okay. I really am.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, you're not okay. If nothing else, you should be at home in bed.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm not going home to bed, Scully. I think I know what's causing this and I know what happened to those two professors and that artifact. I got a sense of it yesterday when I met that man Barnes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You had a sense of it?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes. This man Solomon Merkmallen is dead. Barnes knows it. He killed him-- killed him in that lab.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I hope you're not going to suggest that we arrest him on that rather baseless assumption.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I'm not... not until after I show you what he did with the body.

speaker: LANDLORD
line: I been all through the place. You know what you're looking for?

speaker: MULDER
line: We'll let you know if we find it.

speaker: LANDLORD
line: Ah...cops have been here, too, you know. They couldn't find nothing, either. Feh.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We'll come get you to …

speaker: LANDLORD
line: Yeah, yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: Whatever happened to Dr. Sandoz, he certainly liked to fly south for the winter-- a lot. Gallup, New Mexico. It's Navaho country.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I think I know who he was going to see.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's Albert Hosteen.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Your World War II code-talker

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe he was using him to read the symbols on the artifact.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Or write them. Mulder, you also said that we'd find a body. Care to make good on that prediction?

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, you packing any latex?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. Why?

speaker: MULDER
line: Doesn't it smell like somebody forgot to take out the garbage?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, God.

speaker: SKINNER
line: So you think Dr. Sandoz is innocent?

speaker: MULDER
line: He's afraid for his life because of what he knows and what he has..

speaker: SKINNER
line: This?

speaker: MULDER
line: A genuine artifact-- one of several pieces of an unknown whole. Dr. Barnes has one now, too. That's why he killed Solomon Merkmallen.

speaker: SKINNER
line: The way his body was disposed of...

speaker: MULDER
line: … was to incriminate Sandoz, to make him look like the killer. It's also to hide something. Something that no one would think to look for. Scully, could you please tell... what your medical exam found in the lab report?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Parts of his body were missing-- his arms, his hands, uh, parts of his vital organs and his thyroid.

speaker: MULDER
line: All of which would retain telltale traces of radiation.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Radiation from what?

speaker: MULDER
line: The artifact.

speaker: SCULLY
line: On Agent Mulder's urging I ran tissue samples through what's called a charged particle directional spectrometer. There were traces of a kind of radiation called C.G.R.

speaker: MULDER
line: Cosmic Galactic Radiation. It's a kind of radiation that's found only outside our solar system.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know how to explain it but I feel that we can make an arrest.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, forget the arrest. We got to find these artifacts.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Is there someone else on this case, sir?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Excuse me?

speaker: MULDER
line: There's someone else on this case-- you're not telling me.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What's the hell's he talking about?

speaker: MULDER
line: I hear it... in my head.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, let's go.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, you're losing it.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I'm not. Listen to me-- he's not telling the truth. I'm hearing people. He's spying on us.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, you need to see a doctor.

speaker: MULDER
line: I need to find those artifacts.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'll find the artifacts. You need to go home right now. Mulder...

speaker: NURSE
line: Is there something you're looking for?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, I was looking to speak to Mr. Hosteen.

speaker: NURSE
line: Mr. Hosteen cannot accept any visitors at this time.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, I understand. I saw him wheeled out of here in an emergency.. Can you tell me what's wrong with him?

speaker: NURSE
line: I'm not allowed to give out that kind of information.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I, um, I know him. He's helped me in the past. I'm sure that he wouldn't mind you telling me.

speaker: NURSE
line: Albert has cancer. He's suffering from its effects. He's dying.

speaker: STUDENT
line: Dr. Barnes?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hey!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay... I need answers from you.

speaker: DR. BARNES
line: Are you the man who called?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Dr. Barnes...

speaker: DR. BARNES
line: Yes.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Dr. Barnes you and I are... destined to be great friends.

speaker: DR. SANDOZ
line: Albert was the only translator who didn't dismiss me out of hand. When I showed him the original artifact he sensed immediately its power and importance. The trouble was, it was only one fragment-- not enough to read.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But then other pieces surfaced.

speaker: DR. SANDOZ
line: Dr. Merkmallen found two more in the tidal shallows. He sent me a rubbing. Suddenly, Albert was able to make a real translation.

speaker: SCULLY
line: A passage from the Bible on an artifact that you're saying is extraterrestrial. And, uh, how did the aliens get it?

speaker: DR. SANDOZ
line: They gave it to us. The text came from them. I can prove it.. It's written here. I'm sure of it.

speaker: DR. SANDOZ
line: Albert was working to translate another section when his health turned.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And, uh, this was going to tell us what?

speaker: DR. SANDOZ
line: I don't know yet. Albert said it just seemed to be random letters.

speaker: WOMAN
line: Hello?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hello? I'm sorry. I'm trying to reach Fox Mulder.

speaker: WOMAN
line: Hold on, please.

speaker: WOMAN
line: Fox?

speaker: MULDER
line: Hello?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, where are you?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm here. I'm resting.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where? Who answered the phone?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm home. It's okay. Where are you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm in New Mexico, with, uh, with Dr. Sandoz.

speaker: MULDER
line: Does he have the artifact?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, this, uh, artifact if I'm to believe what I'm being told about it...

speaker: MULDER
line: What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It has a passage on it from Genesis.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, that artifact is extraterrestrial.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, it can't be.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you know what that would mean?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, it would mean nothing, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, it would mean that our progenitors were alien, that our genesis was alien, that we're here because of them; that they put us here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, that is science fiction. It doesn't hold a drop of water.

speaker: MULDER
line: You're wrong. It holds everything. Don't you see? All the mysteries of science everything we can't understand or won't explain, every human behaviorism- cosmology, psychology, everything in the X-Files-- it all owes to them. It's from them.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I will not accept that. It is just not possible.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, then, you go ahead and prove me wrong, Scully.

speaker: DIANA
line: Yes, it's Diana Fowley calling for him. I received a call from Agent Mulder this evening. He was in a particular state of distress. … I don't know why, but I'm staying here until I find out.

speaker: MAN
line: ...final preparations for mass destruction on a scale that can only be imagined. There appears to be nothing we can do to prevent it. It becomes a question of managing the crisis. Otherwise, we are facing annihilation ourselves.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It began with an act of supreme violence-- a big bang expanding ever outward, cosmos born of matter and gas, matter and gas ten billion years ago. Whose idea was this? Who had the audacity for such invention? And the reason? Were we part of that plan ten billion years ago? Are we born only to die? To be fruitful and multiply and replenish the earth before giving way to our generations? If there is a beginning, must there be an end? We burn like fires in our time only to be extinguished. To surrender to the elements' eternal reclaim. Matter and gas... will this all end one day? Life no longer passing to life, the Earth left barren like the stars above, like the cosmos. Will the hand that lit the flame let it burn down? Let it burn out? Could we, too, become extinct? Or if this fire of life living inside us is meant to go on, who decides? Who tends the flames? Can he reignite the spark even as it grows cold and weak?

speaker: DR. SANDOZ
line: The healing ceremony has begun if you want to go inside.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, I, uh, I don't think that's right. I don't share in their faith.

speaker: DR. SANDOZ
line: The medical doctors say they've done everything they could.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know. I think they have. )

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Scully.

speaker: SKINNER
line: It's Skinner. Where are you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm with Dr. Sandoz.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Where?

speaker: SCULLY
line: In Gallup, New Mexico. Where are you?

speaker: SKINNER
line: A hospital in Georgetown. I'm calling with some bad news. Mulder's in serious condition here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What happened to him?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Nobody knows, Agent Scully. You should do whatever you can to get here as soon as possible.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I have to go. I have to leave.

speaker: DR. SANDOZ
line: Please, don't let anyone know where I am... until we know for sure.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They just told me he's in the special psychiatric unit.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I told you on the phone...

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, you said that there was bad news. You didn't tell me what was wrong. Look, I'm sorry. It took me three flights to get here.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I don't know what to do, Dana. No one else does, either. I knew you'd want to be here to see him, to talk to the doctors.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What? What is it?

speaker: DIANA
line: Thank you for coming. He was asking for you last night.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: You really shouldn't be in here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's wrong with him? This man right here, Fox Mulder?

speaker: DOCTOR
line: We don't know what's wrong with him and we don't know what to do for him. He's got extremely abnormal brain function but there is no signs of stroke. We're waiting to run more tests.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Waiting for what?

speaker: DOCTOR
line: He's extremely violent. With what we've given him he should be in a barbiturate coma but there's brain activity in areas we've never seen before.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I want to talk to him.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: No, he's a danger to anyone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Not to me.

speaker: DIANA
line: Can we speak in the hall?

speaker: SCULLY
line: About what?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Scully.

speaker: DIANA
line: When did all this start?

speaker: SCULLY
line: When we took this case... when Skinner gave it to us.

speaker: DIANA
line: What kind of case is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Investigation into a murder.

speaker: DIANA
line: Of whom?

speaker: SKINNER
line: The case has nothing to do with what's happened to him.

speaker: DIANA
line: Agent Scully says it does. Now, you know my background my previous work on the X-Files. If I can help on this case...

speaker: SKINNER
line: The X-File here is a fraud. Scully has ample proof of that-- evidence authenticated by a scholar and authority.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I never sent you that report.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Anyway, the case is being resolved.

speaker: DIANA
line: Not as far as it affects Agent Mulder. If you know what's happening, why won't you tell me?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why were you with him last night?

speaker: DIANA
line: He called me. I found him in a university stairwell. He could barely speak. He said I was the only one who'd believe him-- about an artifact.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're a liar.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Scully!

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're both liars.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hello.

speaker: DR. SANDOZ
line: Agent Scully, Dr. Sandoz. I'm sorry, I didn't know how else to reach you. There's something...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dr. Sandoz, I-I don't know if this is a secure line.

speaker: DR. SANDOZ
line: Yes, all right, but I realized something. The letters Albert translated on the artifact... I know what they are.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What they are?

speaker: DR. SANDOZ
line: Yes. They're coordinates, Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: For what?

speaker: DR. SANDOZ
line: For genes. They're symbols for gene clusters-- the human genome.

speaker: DR. SANDOZ
line: Are you there?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: DR. SANDOZ
line: I think it's all here. The map to our human genetic makeup every gene on every chromosome-- proof of what I've been saying. If only we could find more pieces.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dr. Sandoz? Hello?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dr. Sandoz?

speaker: AFRICAN MAN
line: It's the same. I'll take you, but they are afraid.
